body:
SendImage not working in the new protocol 1.2 implementation.

No error, but no image received.

Message sending working fine!

comment_data.body: I noticed this too, maybe they changed the way you send mms... maybe @waninkoko can give some light since he desciphered the protocol...

@dawnation @waninkoko @kerby82 
I don't think it's about the size now, since I created a very very low quality thumnbnail which the base64 weights like 2kb and the server responded me with the received message:
```sh
tx  <message to="*****@s.whatsapp.net" type="chat" id="*****-1">
tx    <x xmlns="jabber:x:event">
tx      <server></server>
tx    </x>
tx    <media xmlns="urn:xmpp:whatsapp:mms" type="image" url="https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-vT0wjhrlTaQ/T_bwd4_PUYI/AAAAAAAABog/oKPZ6ssJqC0/s673/DSC02471.JPG" file="DSC02471.jpg" size="55508">base64 data</media>
tx  </message>

rx  <presence from="s.whatsapp.net" status="dirty" xmlns="w"></presence>

rx  <message from="*****@s.whatsapp.net" id="*****4-1" type="chat" t="******00">
rx    <received xmlns="urn:xmpp:receipts"></received>
rx  </message>
```
But the phone never received, I think they changed the node format for media, maybe the thumbnail is a url now instead of raw data, the image without the thumbnail sends fine tho.

Maybe someone could sniff actual whatsapp traffic, send an Image and try to decode it.

Definitely agree, the problem with the size was present also in the earlier implementation (protocol 1.1)

But now even if the size is in the accepted range no message received on the client.

If you need any further information I can provide it.

@kerby82 I succefully managed to send an image with a 40x40 gif thumnail that only weights 80bytes but I believe this works only for support to the old protocol.

The problem is that pollingMessages (and receiving them) fails for me, but the think I want to see is an image node received by WhatsAPI then we could see the format.
@beldar can you please give me the base64 of the icon. I just wanna try with your image. If it's not considered confidential data...:-)

@kerby82 shure, it's just a black 40x40 square :P

R0lGODlhKAAoAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAAAAAAALAAAAAAoACgAQAInhI+py+0Po5y02ouz3rz7D4biSJbmiabqyrbuC8fyTNf2jef6ziMFADs=
@beldar do you know some implementation in which send Image works properly? I want to have a look at that an try to port it in php....
@arne-e Ok, can you send me the snippet of the code you use to send the image and the base64 of the image. I'm not able of sending image only the black square that is very few bytes of base64
@arne-e I'm sending images but the phone is not receiving them... did you received the image in your phone with working thumb?
yes i received them... the example thumb and also my own thumbs! :) im using an iphone4 as receiver :)
@arne-e can you paste the xml node the code sent? Like this https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/issues/140#issuecomment-10187890
how do i paste code? :/ it looks destroyed when i just paste it here :/

And the node...? Maybe you have to pass the debug=true to the WhatsProt Class:
```php
$w = new WhatsProt("***********", "***************", "John Doe", true);
```

ive got the node, but when pasting here it looks shitty :D 
wait...

http://pastebin.com/ZAN73MDp

I don't get it, I send the exact same node and can't receive it...

El 09/11/2012, a les 15:34, arne-e <notifications@github.com> va escriure:

ive got the node, but when pasting here it looks shitty :D
wait...

http://pastebin.com/ZAN73MDp

—
Reply to this email directly or view it on
GitHub<https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/issues/140#issuecomment-10228168>.

works like before protocol 1.2 was implented, the only difference that i see is that when receiving an image the thumbnail is already base64 decoded... the node contains allready the raw image. but when sending it has to be base64 encoded.
@arne-e you are using the latest version of the whatsapi php library? i tried with the same data as yours and it did not work. Are your sure is working properly?
yep... im sure... tried it with dozen of images now... always worked perfect... is it possible here to make a private conversation? maybe i can help, but then we wouldnt spam this thread^^
@arne-e you were right it was this all along I just couldn't see there was a $ missing

:) great!
but do you know why there must be a sleep after the last command, otherwise it would be recognized by the server?
It seems that that the server reply to the client and if the client close the connection as long as sending the image without waiting for a reply it does not work....
but sleep() doesnt pull any answers from the server?

Maybe it's about the received node, the server always sends to the client.
Maybe you must wait for the received node before sending another message.
But we have to check if the connection with the server it's closed exiting from the sendImage function or exiting from the php script

@arne-e maybe the sleep works because while the script sleeps, the received node is received.
And in the last case the second message doesn't send 'cause the received node wasn't received yet.
I'm just theorizing, but I would take a look to this: https://github.com/koenk/whatspoke/blob/master/doc/messages.md it's old protocol but the dynamic i think is the same.
If you want to go more deep: https://github.com/koenk/whatspoke/blob/master/doc/funxmpp.txt
And this can explain why sending few bytes works. Theorizing we can think that in that case the node after sending the image is received.

@beldar you mean this "Our message was received by server: S>C" ?
but i dont understand why this should be the point. is WhatAPI responding to this message? its atleast not said in messages.md... for me it looks more like just an info message. in the real client it would be the first green tick (received by server) and the second for received by opponent.
but why should the server not deliver the message when i dont pull the received message.
and i still dont understand why while sleeping something is received? when the script is sleeping the script doesnt do anything i think? :/

This is what is happening after sending an image:

http://pastebin.com/FnDLtCHk

The id is the one used for sending the Image. So it seems that the server replies something related with the message. We can think about the iphone app, we have like a progressing bar that when the message is sent disappear. If the client does not accomplish all the process cause the server to not deliver the message.

Does it make sense?
but when using sleep() you dont pull this message from the server...?!
It's not if you pull it more if you send something before the server can send it

I guess i got it the reason.

I put a sleep of 20000 second for understanding what is happening.

When you launch the script there is an established connection to whatsapp:

tcp4     336      0  192.168.1.3.63054      50.22.231.56.5222      ESTABLISHED

When you quit the script the established connection is reset.

So if you send the image and then you quit as long as the function return you are resetting the connection and the node sent you back by the server cannot be delivered by the server itself, this cause the server to not deliver the message.

It's just a theory but can make sense.

It's not about pulling the message it's about closing the connection too early...

so always end the script when using whatsapi with

sleep(1);
?>

and youre on the safe side :P

I'm implementing a WaitforReceipt() function

El 10/11/2012, a les 15:32, Andrea <notifications@github.com> va escriure:

@arne-e <https://github.com/arne-e> unfortunately this is not the solution.
I would expect to implement the correct way to check if everything is
delivered in the right way. Sleep 1 second is not a solution an can work
bad in certain condition, especially considering the network issue you can
have

—

title: sendImage not working in new implementation protocol 1.2
